trans-unit.source: Provides information about network interfaces that support Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4).
This class provides access to configuration and address information for network interfaces that support IPv4.
You do not create instances of this class; they are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv4Properties%2A> method.
For IPV6 properties, see <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv6Properties%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceProperties"></xref> class.
This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceProperties>.
Gets the index of the network interface associated with the Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) address.
If the value of this property is zero, IPv4 is not supported by this interface.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that contains the index of the IPv4 interface.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether this interface has an automatic private IP addressing (APIPA) address.

Automatic private IP addressing allows computers that do not have access to a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server to be automatically assigned an IP address that does not conflict with public addresses.
These addresses are in the range 169.254.0.0 to 169.254.255.255.
`true` if the interface uses an APIPA address; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether this interface has automatic private IP addressing (APIPA) enabled.

Automatic private IP addressing allows computers that do not have access to a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server to be automatically assigned an IP address that does not conflict with public addresses.
These addresses are in the range 169.254.0.0 to 169.254.255.255.
`true` if the interface uses APIPA; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether the interface is configured to use a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server to obtain an IP address.
When this property is `true`, a DHCP server assigns the IP address to the interface when the computer establishes its network connections.
`true` if the interface is configured to obtain an IP address from a DHCP server; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether this interface can forward (route) packets.
If routing is disabled, packets that are received by the interface with a destination address that is not held by the interface are discarded.
`true` if this interface routes packets; otherwise `false`.
Gets the maximum transmission unit (MTU) for this network interface.
The MTU of a network interface is the largest packet that can be transmitted.
It is measured in octets (8-bit bytes).
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that specifies the MTU.
Gets a <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref> value that indicates whether an interface uses Windows Internet Name Service (WINS).
WINS provides a distributed database for registering and querying dynamic NetBIOS names to IPv4 address mappings.
`true` if the interface uses WINS; otherwise, `false`.
